properties.name: Apotheosis of St. Louis - Statue of Louis IX
properties.description: Posted by Sb3grand forest park, st louis, moEquestrian statue of Louis IX, Crusader King of France

properties.name: Brooklyn Ale House
properties.description: Posted by Sb3grand103 berry st., brooklyn, nyNice neighborhoody place. "Dog-friendly", too. They had great homemade cider around Christmas.

properties.name: Caffe Dante
properties.description: Posted by Sb3grand  79 macdougal st, nyc

properties.name: Churchill Arms
properties.description: Posted by Sb3grandkensington, london, ukA fancyapint.co.uk "5 pint" pub that lives up to its rating. Good Thai food, too.

properties.name: Cutty Sark
properties.description: Posted by Sb3grandGreenwich, London, UKThe famous tea ship and liquor namesake

properties.name: Encounter @ LAX
properties.description: Posted by Sb3grandlos angeles international airportRetro-futuristic bar/restuarant in the old LAX control tower. Worth a visit if you\'ve got time to kill before or between flights.

properties.name: Erato Wine Bar
properties.description: Posted by Sb3grand edwardsville, il

properties.name: Frederick's Music Lounge
properties.description: Posted by Sb3grand  kingshighway, st louis, moR.I.P. Great music venue and unique bar that closed in February 2006. If you never made it, kick yourself.

properties.name: Greenwich Foot Tunnel Entrance
properties.description: Posted by Sb3grandgreenwich, london, ukSouth entrance of the pedestrian tunnel under the Thames

properties.name: Greenwich Foot Tunnel Entrance @ Island Gardens
properties.description: Posted by Sb3grandlondon, ukEnter here to walk under the Thames to Greenwich

properties.name: Lincoln Lounge
properties.description: Posted by Sb3grand121 n. main, decatur, ilIf you find yourself in Decatur for some reason, pay tribute to The Great Emancipator here. Nothing fancy, but kind of a cool old place with some nice Lincoln-related decor behind the bar.

properties.name: Mall Tavern
properties.description: Posted by Sb3grand Fancyapint only gives it 2 pints (out of 5) but I have sentimental attachment - the first pub I went to in London. Nice vine covered beer garden for a summer afternoon.

properties.name: Missouri History Museum
properties.description: Posted by Sb3grand     forest park, st louis, mo

properties.name: Northwest Coffee Roasting
properties.description: Posted by Sb3grand st. louis, mogood stuff

properties.name: Paul's Club
properties.description: Posted by Sb3grand212 state st, madison, wiAn online review I found said it best - "I mean, sweet Jesus, there\'s a tree in the bar, how cool is that?"

properties.name: Pianos
properties.description: Posted by Sb3grand158 ludlow st, nycSaw the great John Hodgman do a reading here in December \'05.

properties.name: Pride of Spitalfields
properties.description: Posted by Sb3grandspitalfields, london, ukHad a great time at this pub just off Brick Lane. I only found out much later that the place had been fire-bombed not long before I was there (summer \'03) by some local gang. It didn\'t seem to have hurt their business, though. Hopefully its still going strong.

properties.name: Scottish Arms
properties.description: Posted by Sb3grandsarah st, st louis, moScottish restaurant (with surprisingly good food) and pub

properties.name: The Banker
properties.description: Posted by Sb3grandlondon, ukPub with Thames views and Fuller\'s beer. That\'s all you need to know.

properties.name: The Blackfriar
properties.description: Posted by Sb3grandblackfriars, londonWorth a visit for the decor alone. Nice outdoor seating area, too, if the weather\'s good.

properties.name: The Globe
properties.description: Posted by Sb3grandRecently revisited this old haunt of mine for the first time in many years. Still excellent, and now they serve food, too.

properties.name: The Map Room
properties.description: Posted by Sb3grand1949 n. hoyne, chicago, ILLow key bar. Great beer selection. Map & geography theme.

properties.name: University of Wisconsin Union Terrace
properties.description: Posted by Sb3grand800 langdon st, madison, wiBest student union ever. Great summertime place. They actually have good beer. Almost makes me wish I went to school here.

properties.name: Wainwright Building
properties.description: Posted by Sb3grand101 n 7th st, st louis, moBeautiful Louis Sullivan-designed building. Unfortunately, a generically ugly \'80\'s office building was built directly south of it - in the middle of the Gateway Mall linear open space! - blocking views of the Wainwright.

properties.name: Washington Square Arch
properties.description: Posted by Sb3grandDesigned by architect Stanford White (of McKim, Mead & White), who was shot dead several years later at Madison Square Garden by a jealous husband.

properties.name: Windsor Castle
properties.description: Posted by Sb3grandlondon, ukOne of at least 4 Windsor Castle pubs in London. This actually wasn\'t the one I thought I was going to, but it turned out to be a good one. Nice beer garden.

properties.name: d.b.a.
properties.description: Posted by Sb3grand41 first ave, nycAmazing selection - esp. beer and liquor. Small, dark, cozy room. When I was there, they played the entire Elvis Costello "Get Happy" album on the stereo!
